title: Change in potential due to change in charge

content.question: Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from each of two small charged spheres, as shown above. The first sphere has charge <math alttext="Q sub 1 equals Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> , and the second sphere has charge <math alttext="Q sub 2 equals 2 Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> . The electric potential at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> . What would be the new potential at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> if the charge on the first sphere is <math alttext="2 Q sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the charge on the second sphere is <math alttext="3 Q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
